page.title: 20HEALTH IN THIS AREA(CONT)
page.content:
locally is provided by the National Health Service, and paid for by taxes so that people do not have to pay any extra for medical care when they are ill.
The health of children is carefully monitored from the moment the mother's pregnancy is confirmed by her G.P.She attends an ante-natal clinic at the local hospital where the baby is usually born.After the birth a Health Visitor regularly visits the child in the home and is also present at the Area Health Authority Clinic which is held in the local village hall.On entering school the child is also examined by the School Doctor appointed by the local health authority and this is repeated at regular intervals.
